intro: Centropogon albolimbatus, commonly known as the white-limbed centropogon, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slight pubescence. Centropogon albolimbatus is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and along stream banks.
